did.abstract: This collection contains material related to William Scheuerman, a local, state, and national labor leader.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by William Scheuerman in 2014, and 2016-2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: William Scheuerman is a local, state, and national labor leader. He has served as president of the National Labor College, president and vice president for academics of and chief negotiator for United University Professions, and on the board of directors and as an executive committee member for New York State United Teachers among others. He also was professor in the Department of Political Science at the State University of New York at Oswego.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material related to William Scheuerman's labor union work, including United University Professions, correspondence; articles, speeches, photographs, commentaries, letters to the editor, political materials, including those from the 1996 and 2000 Democratic National Conventions, awards, and VHS tapes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, William Scheuerman Papers, 1982-2010. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Scheuerman Papers).

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The archivist transferred one monograph: A New American Labor Movement: Decline of Collective Bargaining and the Rise of Direct Action by William Scheuerman to the book division of Special Collections. It will be catalogued and included in the University Library Catalog.
